Passive- Syphoning:
Each time  Lu’ark levels up they gain Extra Max Mana equal to 1% of their Current max Mana 
(includes level 1 upon starting game) rounded up, Lu’ark cannot gain AP, all Lu’ark's AP is converted into bonus mana. Lu’ark's abilities can Crit dealing bonus magic damage but his auto attacks cannot. Whenever Lu’ark's abilities Critically strike he gains temporary mana equal to 20% of maximum mana that lasts for a few seconds. Lu’ark is granted 10% Crit chance
Q- Vortex Slam
 Lu’ark Summons a vortex from the void and slams it down, the vortex slows Enemy Champions. The Vortex Deals 80% damage to minions
Passive : Grants Lu’ark additional 10/10/15/20/20% Bonus Critical Strike Chance 

W- Crystal Shift
Lu’ark teleports in a target direction and leaves a Void crystal behind which returns to him and damages anything it travels through dealing decreased damage for each unit it damaged (minimum 50%) Lu’ark gains 80/100/120/140/180 temporary mana, critically striking increases this by 5/7/9/12/15%

E- Crystal Enchantment 
100/125/150/175/200 hp shield
If you have 120 Temporary Mana or More Slow Nearby Enemies
If you have 180 Temporary mana or More Root Nearby Enemies
If you have 240 Temporary Mana or More Cleanse Lu’ark Of Slows
If you have 300 Temporary Mana or More Cleanse Lu’ark Of All CC and Increases names damage dealt for 5/7/9 seconds
Passive: After  5/7/9/12/15 seconds Temporary mana changes to Mana 

R- Void Transfusion
Consumes all temporary mana increase damage and movement speed by how much consumed for 20/25/30 seconds and replace “Void Transfusion” with “Voidsplosion” which  deals ap damage in an area near a vortex or a crystal Giving Lu’ark More Temporary mana  enemy champion hit
5%increase to damage per 100 Temporary mana consumed.

replies.body:
Temporary mana and ability crit chance are definitely both interesting mechanics. 

Some small things to elaborate on is for Q and E how long are the slows and roots meant to last? and how powerful are the slows?

For E after 15 seconds temporary mana changes to mana, but from reading the passive temp mana only lasts a few seconds?

Those were just some small things but the main thing is that you talk about this guy being a control mid mage, I'm not feeling that vibe from him.

Can you explain what a player should be experiencing when playing this champion?

Why does a control mage have spell crit chance (doesn't this push players towards burst?)

It feels like this guy needs to get right into the fray to be effective (and he has the tools to do so) feels more like a mage fighter than a control mage.

Why did you choose these abilities for the champion as a control mage?

Why do you feel this is fun to play as and against?

good questions that we all forgot to do, we where originally going for control but it seems we came up with more of fighter, but this development has created a unique and on paper a very fun  champion, i guess he should be a mage fighter based on burst, i guess we had the wrong idea for your last  question

This would be very very very fun to play considering its all about how well you can time things to do with your temporary mana, and the fact and you have to build a mix between Health mana and crit chance to get the most and the fact that he can do more damage which is very unique along with his temporary mana

playing against him would be fun as you have to keep track of his mana and keep him from farming due to they fact on how his item build for mana would be a bit expensive, mainly consisting of Scepter, roa, Infinity edge and maybe Gunblade i9 have a few questions from you Maraudaur

What would you expect from this on paper???

Does This champion concept really feel unique????

Can you personally imagine it in league of legends??
The champ has natural crit chance?
his passive effect gives him 10% crit
